briefdescription.para: String indicating in which presentation mode the user is (sample, time frame).
The time maximum in second.
Mode of presentation used, spike sample or time frame.
Boolean indicating if all the waveforms, corresponding to the mode of presentation, are shown or if only the mean and the standard deviation.
Boolean indicating if the waveforms for the presented clusters have to overlay.
Minimal abscissa in window coordinate.
Maximal abscissa in window coordinate.
Minimal ordinate in window coordinate.
Maximal ordinate in window coordinate.
Number of points used to describe a waveform.
Position of the peak among the points decribing the waveform.
Number of electrodes used in that experiment.
The width border.
The height border.
The delta between the starting abscisses of two clusters.
Abscissa step between two points of a given spike.
Abscissa space between two clusters.
Ordinate space between two electrodes.
The abscissa of the system coordinate center for the channel which is presented at the top of the view.
The ordinate of the system coordinate center for the channel which is presented at the top of the view.
Acquisition system gain.
The actual gain is 0.75 raised to the power of gain times the acquisition system gain.
Size in pixels corresponding to the amplitude maximal.
Factor use to calculate the ordinate value to been drawn.

detaileddescription.para: The factor equals YsizeForMaxAmp divided by gain.

briefdescription.para: Index positions of the channels.
When the presentation mode is time frame, this variable keeps track of the current start time of the time window.
When the presentation mode is time frame, this variable keeps track of the current end time of the time window.

True is the data where recording using a 12 or 16 bits recording system which gives data coded on 2 bytes, false otherwise (the recording is then assume to be 32 bits and then the data are coded on 4 bytes.
List of pointers on the threads which have to be suppress when this object is destroy.
List of pointers on the threads for which the result should not be taken into account.

detaileddescription.para: If a cluster is modified while a thread launch to obtain the cluster's data is running a second thread will be launch. In that case only the result of the last thread shoud be used.

briefdescription.para: True if the waveform information needed to draw the waveforms are available.
List of the clusters to be disregared because they have been changed.
The number of spikes to display in sample mode.
True if the view has been zoomed, false ohterwise.
True if the widget is about to be deleted, false otherwise.
Border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).

memberdef.argsstring: (KlustersDoc &doc, KlustersView &view, QColor backgroundColor, int acquisitionGain, QValueList< int > positions, KStatusBar *statusBar, QWidget *parent=0, bool isTimeFrameMode=false, long start=0, long timeFrameWidth=0, long nbSpkToDisplay=0, bool overLay=false, bool mean=false, const char *name=0, int minSize=50, int maxSize=4000, int windowTopLeft=-500, int windowBottomRight=1001, int border=0)
memberdef.name: WaveformView

inbodydescription.para: Initialize the position of the channels (the positions will be configurable in the settings).

briefdescription.para: Signals that the widget is about to be deleted.
Updates the view only for one cluster for which the color has been changed.

parameterdescription.para: cluster Id for which the color have changed.
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Draws an additional cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
clusterId
cluster Id to add to the clusters already drawn
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Removes a cluster from those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
Which impose to redraw everything
clusterId
cluster Id to remove.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Adds a newly created cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromClusters
list of clusters from which the spikes of the new cluster are coming.
clusterId
cluster Id to add to the clusters already drawn
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Adds a newly created cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
clusterId
cluster Id to add to the clusters already drawn
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Updates the content of the widget due to the removal of spikes in a cluster.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromClusters
list of clusters from which the spikes have been taken.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Updates the content of the widget due to the addition of spikes in a cluster.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
clusterId
cluster Id to which the spikes have been added
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Changes the current mode, call by a selection of a tool.

parameterdescription.para: new mode of drawing (selection or zoom)

briefdescription.para: Updates the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
isModifiedByDeletion
true if the clusters of modifiedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).

briefdescription.para: Updates the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

detaileddescription.para:
This method is call only during an undo otherwise the updateClusters is call. There are 2 functions in order to reduce the number of clusters to draw whenever possible.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the way of presenting the information concerning the waveforms selected to only show the waveforms of the mean and the standard deviation.
Sets the way of presenting the information concerning the waveforms selected to show all the waveforms corresponding to the mode of presentation.
The waveforms of each cluster are overlaying.
The waveforms of each cluster are presented side by side.
Sets the mode of presentation to sample mode, meaning that, for each shown cluster, only one out of the number of spikes to be displayed will be shown.
Sets the mode of presentation to time frame mode, meaning that, for each shown cluster, only the spikes within the current time frame will be shown.
Changes the time and update the view accordingly.

parameterdescription.para: start time of the time frame in second.
width of the time frame in second.

briefdescription.para: Sets the initial maximum amplitude of the waveforms.

parameterdescription.para: the new value to set the initial maximum amplitude of the waveforms (before increase or decrease).

briefdescription.para: Increase of the amplitude of the waveforms.
Decrease of the amplitude of the waveforms.
Increase of the number of samples display in the sample mode.
Enables the caller to know if there is any thread running launch by the view.
Update the information presented in the view if need it.
Initialize the position of the channels in the view.

parameterdescription.para: positions of the channels to use in the view set by the user in the settings dialog.

briefdescription.para: Update the information presented in the view after a renumbering if need it.

parameterdescription.para: true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Prints the currently display information on a printer via the painter printPainter.

parameterdescription.para: object providing information about the printer.
true if the printed background has to be white, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Draws the contents of the frame.

parameterdescription.para: painter used to draw the contents of the frame.

briefdescription.para: Treat the events sent by the WaveformThread instances.
The view responds to a double click.

detaileddescription.para:
The waveforms are retrieve in case the data have changed (an other view has changed its parameters) as all the views are sharing the same data.
event
mouse event.

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a mouse click.

detaileddescription.para:
The waveforms are retrieve in case the data have changed (an other view has changed its parameters) as all the views are sharing the same data.
event
mouse release event.

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a resize event.

detaileddescription.para:
The waveforms are retrieve in case the data have changed (an other view has changed its parameters) as all the views are sharing the same data.
event
resize event.

briefdescription.para: Draws the waveforms of the clusters in the list clustersList on the given painter.

parameterdescription.para: painter on which to draw the waveforms

briefdescription.para: Updates the dimension of the window.
Creates a thread which will get the waveform information.
Asks the waveform information for the cluster clusterId by launching a WaveformThread.

parameterdescription.para: id of the cluster to ask waveform information for.

briefdescription.para: Asks the waveform information for the clusters listed in clusterIds by launching a WaveformThread.

parameterdescription.para: ids of the clusters to ask waveform information for.

briefdescription.para: Adds the clusters to the list of those to be updated and get the updated waveform information for it.
Draws the clusters identifiers.

parameterdescription.para: painter on which to draw the information

briefdescription.para: View displaying the waveforms of a subset of the spikes evenly spaced in time over the whole recording.

detaileddescription.para:
Using the spin boxes in the Parameter Bar, the user can specify which spikes to use. All modification request is sent directly to the KlustersDoc object and the view is automatically updated via KlustersView when the waveforms have been changed. If the view is active, it is also automatically updated when clusers are changed.
Lynn Hazan
